newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan PM expects hostage crisis to drag on.
newsitem.headline: Japan PM expects hostage crisis to drag on.

text.p: Japanese Prime Minister Ryutaro Hashimoto said on Tuesday the hostage crisis at the Japanese ambassador's residence in Lima would take time to resolve.
"I think it will take time (to resolve the crisis)," Hashimoto told reporters shortly after speaking by telephone with Peruvian President Alberto Fujimori.

But Hashimoto said a delay in settling the week-long crisis would indicate that force would not be used to free the remaining hostages, who number about 140, being held in the residence by Marxist guerrillas.
"The fact that it will take time means that no get-tough approach will be taken," Hashimoto said.
Hashimoto said that during his conversation with Fujimori he pledged Japan's continued full backing to Peru in resolving the crisis.
